intro: Leptocarpus neglectus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils near the shoreline, thriving in saline and well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, while its stems are erect and somewhat succulent. Leptocarpus neglectus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize coastal dunes.
